title: Matt Dawson names the three New Zealand players who went missing vs 'invincible' England
text:
Beauden Barrett endured a difficult night against a rampant England (Picture: Getty)

World Cup winner Matt Dawson claimed England now look ‘invincible’ after recording a stunning victory against New Zealand.

The All Blacks, protecting a 12-year unbeaten record in the competition and seeking a third straight success, had no answer to a ferocious England display led by the likes of skipper Owen Farrell and man of the match Maro Itoje.

Eddie Jones’ side will now face the winner of tomorrow’s clash between South Africa and Wales in the final but beating New Zealand in such comprehensive fashion will do England’s confidence the power of good, according to Dawson.

Much was expected from New Zealand’s world class performers but Dawson was stunned to watch England limit the impact of their most creative players and dominant ball carriers.

He told the BBC: ‘It was comprehensive, it really was. We’re going to sound like arrogant Pommies here but from minute one, from the kick-off, from the haka, they were mentally in the right spot to throw something on the All Blacks.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘The pressure they put on New Zealand, you saw them start to crack. Where was Beauden Barrett, where was Savea, where was Retallick?

‘That’s not a reflection on them, it’s a reflection on how well England played.

‘They are now in the final, which makes this next week so much easier, so much more relaxed.

They don’t need to do much work, they can rest up, focus on the opposition, do loads of video analysis – if they do the detail for next week as much as they did today they are close to invincible.’
description: World Cup winner Matt Dawson claimed England now look 'invincible' after recording a stunning victory against New Zealand. The All Blacks, protecting a 12-year unbeaten record in the competition and...
